nodes.title: LVMH's Business Segments
nodes.body: LVMH divides its business into five segments: Fashion & Leather Goods, Selective Retailing, Watches & Jewelry, Perfumes & Cosmetics, and Other Activities (luxury hotels, yachts).

nodes.title: LVMH's Market Position
nodes.body: As of writing, LVMH is the largest luxury conglomerate, with a market cap of roughly $360 billion, making it the second-biggest public company in Europe and 20th in the world.

nodes.title: LVMH's Formation
nodes.body: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton was formed in 1987 through a merger between Louis Vuitton and Moët Hennessy, combining expertise in fashion/leather goods and champagne/cognac respectively.

nodes.title: Bernard Arnault's Vision
nodes.body: Bernard Arnault had the vision of housing multiple prestigious luxury brands or 'maisons' under one umbrella, which he turned into reality through strategic mergers and acquisitions over nearly four decades.
